de.larssh.utils.test

Class AssertEqualsAndHashCodeArguments

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.larssh.utils.test.AssertEqualsAndHashCodeArguments

  • public class AssertEqualsAndHashCodeArguments
extends Object
    Value object containing arguments in an original and a changed form, to be used for asserting the methods Object.equals(Object) and Object.hashCode().

    The following example is made for a class called Person. That class contains three fields (see below) and a constructor accordingly.

    1. Personal ID (used for equality)
    2. First name (not used for equality)
    3. Last name (not used for equality) 
     assertEqualsAndHashCode(a -> new Person((int) a[0], (String) a[0], (String) a[0]),
     new AssertEqualsAndHashCodeArguments()
         .add(123, 456, true)
         .add('John', 'Jane', false)
         .add('Doe', 'Smith', false));
